p: Another way to fight the virus, apart from stopping it replicating, is to follow our immune system's lead and look to antibodies. Biotech start-up AbCellera, based in Vancouver, began this process by rapidly identifying all the antibodies in a blood sample taken from someone who had recovered from covid-19. The company then tested them for their activity against the new coronavirus. Within a week of receiving the sample, AbCellera had identified 500 promising antibodies among the millions, or even billions, in the sample, says Ester Falconer, the company's head of research and development. It is now working with Indiana-based drugs firm Eli Lilly to develop an antibody-based therapy for covid-19 and have it ready for testing with a faster-than-ever turnaround. “In four months, we can do something that normally takes five to 10 years,” says Falconer.
